body: Q30 According to best practices, how should an application be designed to run in the AWS Cloud? 根据最佳实践，应如何设计应用程序以在 AWS 云中运行?

choices.A: Use tighly coupled components.->使用紧密耦合的组件.
choices.B: Use loosely coupled components.->使用松散耦合的组件.
choices.C: Use infrequently coupled components.->使用不经常耦合的组件.
choices.D: Use frequently coupled components.->使用频繁耦合的组件.

ans_desc: As application complexity increases, a desirable attribute of an IT system is that it can be broken into smaller, loosely coupled components. This means that IT systems should be designed in a way that reduces interdependencies—a change or a failure in one component should not cascade to other components.https://d1.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/AWS_Cloud_Best_Practices.pdf  随着应用程序复杂性的增加，IT 系统的一个理想属性是它可以分解成更小的.松散耦合的组件.这意味着 IT 系统的设计方式应减少相互依赖性——一个组件的更改或故障不应级联到其他组件. https://d1.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/AWS_Cloud_Best_Practices.pdf

ans_desc: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It provides cost-efficient and resizable capacity while automating time-consuming administration tasks such as hardware provisioning, database setup, patching and backups. It frees you to focus on your applications so you can give them the fast performance, high availability, security and compatibility they need. https://aws.amazon.com/rds/ c=db&sec=srv  Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) 使在云中设置.操作和扩展关系数据库变得容易.它提供经济高效且可调整大小的容量，同时自动执行耗时的管理任务，例如硬件配置.数据库设置.修补和备份.它让您可以专注于您的应用程序，从而为它们提供所需的快速性能.高可用性.安全性和兼容性. https://aws.amazon.com/rds/?c=db&sec=srv

body: Q67 Which AWS service provides a simple and scalable shared file storage solution for use with Linux-based AWS and on-premises servers? 哪种 AWS 服务提供简单且可扩展的共享文件存储解决方案，用于基于 Linux 的 AWS 和本地服务器?

choices.A: Amazon S3
choices.B: Amazon Glacier
choices.C: Amazon EBS
choices.D: Amazon EFS

ans_desc: Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) provides a simple, scalable, fully managed elastic NFS file system for use with AWS Cloud services and on-premises resources. It is built to scale on demand to petabytes without disrupting applications, growing and shrinking automatically as you add and remove files, eliminating the need to provision and manage capacity to accommodate growth. Amazon EFS is designed to provide the throughput, IOPS, and low latency needed for Linux workloads.Throughput and IOPS scale as a file system grows and can burst to higher throughput levels for short periods of time to support the unpredictable performance needs of file workloads. For the most demanding workloads, Amazon EFS can support performance over 10 GB/sec and up to 500,000 IOPS.  Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) 提供了一个简单.可扩展.完全托管的弹性 NFS 文件系统，可用于 AWS 云服务和本地资源.它可以根据需要扩展到 PB 级，而不会中断应用程序，在您添加和删除文件时自动增长和缩小，无需预置和管理容量以适应增长. Amazon EFS 旨在提供 Linux 工作负载所需的吞吐量.IOPS 和低延迟.吞吐量和 IOPS 会随着文件系统的增长而扩展，并且可以在短时间内突增到更高的吞吐量水平，以支持文件工作负载的不可预测的性能需求.对于要求最苛刻的工作负载，Amazon EFS 可以支持超过 10 GB/秒的性能和高达 500,000 IOPS.

body: Q69 Which AWS service should be used for long-term, low-cost storage of data backups? 应该使用哪种 AWS 服务来长期.低成本地存储数据备份?

choices.A: Amazon RDS
choices.B: Amazon Glacier
choices.C: AWS Snowball
choices.D: AWS EBS

ans_desc: Amazon S3 Glacier is a secure, durable, and low-cost storage class of S3 for data archiving and long-term backup. Customers can store large or small amounts of data for as little as $0.004 per gigabyte per month. The S3 Glacier storage class is ideal for archives where data is regularly retrieved and some of the data may be needed in minutes. Amazon RDS is a relational database service that hosts databases. It helps you create and manage databases. Amazon Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transfer service that provides cost efficient data transfer to AWS from tamper proof physical devices. Similarly, Elastic block storage offers persistent block storage volumes for EC2 instances.https://aws.amazon.com/backup-restore/services/  Amazon S3 Glacier 是一种安全.耐用且低成本的 S3 存储类，用于数据归档和长期备份.客户可以以每月每 GB 0.004 美元的价格存储大量或少量数据. S3 Glacier 存储类非常适合定期检索数据并且可能在几分钟内需要一些数据的存档. Amazon RDS 是一种托管数据库的关系数据库服务.它可以帮助您创建和管理数据库. Amazon Snowball 是一种 PB 级数据传输服务，可提供从防篡改物理设备到 AWS 的经济高效的数据传输.同样，弹性块存储为 EC2 实例提供持久块存储卷. https://aws.amazon.com/backup-restore/services/

body: Q70 Which task is AWS responsible for in the shared responsibility model for security and compliance? AWS 在安全性和合规性责任共担模型中负责哪项任务?

choices.A: Granting access to individuals and services->授予个人和服务访问权限
choices.B: Encrypting data in transit->加密传输中的数据
choices.C: Updating Amazon EC2 host firmware->更新 Amazon EC2 主机固件
choices.D: Updating operating systems->更新操作系统

ans_desc: Because customer is responsible for encrypting data in transportation. Answer must be C. Yes, customer may need to update operating system. However, customer has no access to the underlying firmware. That is responsibility of AWS.  因为客户负责在运输过程中对数据进行加密.答案必须是 C.是的，客户可能需要更新操作系统.但是，客户无权访问底层固件.这是 AWS 的责任.

body: Q72 Which of the following is a benefit of using the AWS Cloud? 以下哪一项是使用 AWS 云的好处?

choices.A: Permissive security removes the administrative burden.->Permissive 安全性消除了管理负担.
choices.B: Ability to focus on revenue-generating activities.->专注于创收活动的能力.
choices.C: Control over cloud network hardware.->控制云网络硬件.

choices.C: Apply the same IAM policy to all IAM users with access to the same workload.->将相同的 IAM 策略应用于有权访问相同工作负载的所有 IAM 用户.
choices.D: Apply an IAM policy to an Amazon Cognito user pool.->将 IAM 策略应用于 Amazon Cognito 用户池.

ans_desc: Instead of defining permissions for individual IAM users, it's usually more convenient to create groups that relate to job functions (administrators, developers,accounting, etc.). Next, define the relevant permissions for each group. Finally, assign IAM users to those groups. All the users in an IAM group inherit the permissions assigned to the group. That way, you can make changes for everyone in a group in just one place. As people move around in your company, you can simply change what IAM group their IAM user belongs to.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html  创建与工作职能（管理员.开发人员.会计等）相关的组通常更方便，而不是为单个 IAM 用户定义权限.接下来，为每个组定义相关权限.最后，将 IAM 用户分配给这些组. IAM 组中的所有用户都会继承分配给该组的权限.这样，您就可以在一个地方为组中的每个人进行更改.随着人们在您的公司中四处走动，您可以简单地更改他们的 IAM 用户所属的 IAM 组.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

body: Q90 Which of the following is an AWS Cloud architecture design principle? 以下哪一项是 AWS 云架构设计原则?

choices.A: Implement single points of failure.->实施单点故障.
choices.B: Implement loose coupling.->实现松耦合.
choices.C: Implement monolithic design.->实施单体设计.
choices.D: Implement vertical scaling.->实现垂直缩放.

ans_desc: Loose coupling between services can also be done through asynchronous integration. It involves one component that generates events and another that consumes them. The two components do not integrate through direct point-to-point interaction, but usually through an intermediate durable storage layer. This approach decouples the two components and introduces additional resiliency. So, for example, if a process that is reading messages from the queue fails, messages can still be added to the queue to be processed when the system recovers.https://www.botmetric.com/blog/aws-cloud-architecture-design-principles/  服务之间的松耦合也可以通过异步集成来完成.它涉及一个生成事件的组件和另一个使用它们的组件.这两个组件不是通过直接的点对点交互来集成的，而是通常通过一个中间持久存储层来集成.这种方法将这两个组件解耦并引入了额外的弹性.因此，例如，如果从队列中读取消息的进程失败，消息仍然可以添加到队列中以在系统恢复时进行处理. https://www.botmetric.com/blog/aws-cloud-architecture -设计原则/

ans_desc: If you decided to create service accounts (that is, accounts used for programmatic access by applications running outside of the AWS environment) and generate access keys for them, you should create a dedicated service account for each use case. This will allow you to restrict the associated policy to only the permissions needed for the particular use case, limiting the blast radius if the credentials are compromised. For example, if a monitoring tool and a release management tool both require access to your AWS environment, create two separate service accounts with two separate policies that define the minimum set of permissions for each tool.https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/security/guidelines-for-protecting-your-aws-account-while-using-programmatic-access/  如果您决定创建服务账户（即，用于在 AWS 环境之外运行的应用程序进行编程访问的账户）并为其生成访问密钥，您应该为每个用例创建一个专用服务账户.这将允许您将关联的策略限制为仅特定用例所需的权限，如果凭据被泄露，则限制爆炸半径.例如，如果监控工具和发布管理工具都需要访问您的 AWS 环境，请使用两个单独的策略创建两个单独的服务账户，这些策略定义了每个工具的最小权限集.https://aws.amazon.com/博客/安全/指导方针，用于保护您的 aws 帐户同时使用程序访问/

ans_desc: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage. Customers use Storage Gateway to simplify storage management and reduce costs for key hybrid cloud storage use cases. These include moving tape backups to the cloud, reducing on-premises storage with cloud-backed file shares, providing low latency access to data in AWS for on-premises applications, as well as various migration, archiving, processing, and disaster recovery use cases.https://aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/ whats-new-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.postDateTime&whats-new-cards.sort-order=desc  AWS Storage Gateway 是一种混合云存储服务，可让您在本地访问几乎无限的云存储.客户使用 Storage Gateway 来简化存储管理并降低关键混合云存储用例的成本.其中包括将磁带备份移动到云，通过云支持的文件共享减少本地存储，为本地应用程序提供对 AWS 中数据的低延迟访问，以及各种迁移.归档.处理和灾难恢复用例.https://aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/?whats-new-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.postDateTime&whats-new-cards.sort-order=desc

ans_desc: Amazon ElastiCache for Redis is a great choice for implementing a highly available, distributed, and secure in-memory cache to decrease access latency,increase throughput, and ease the load off your relational or NoSQL databases and applications. ElastiCache can serve frequently requested items at sub-millisecond response times, and enables you to easily scale for higher loads without growing the costlier backend databases. Database query results caching, persistent session caching, and full-page caching are all popular examples of caching with ElastiCache for Redis.https://aws.amazon.com/products/databases/real-time-apps-elasticache-for-redis/  Amazon ElastiCache for Redis 是实施高度可用.分布式和安全的内存缓存以减少访问延迟.提高吞吐量并减轻关系或 NoSQL 数据库和应用程序的负载的绝佳选择. ElastiCache 可以在亚毫秒级的响应时间内为频繁请求的项目提供服务，并使您能够轻松扩展以适应更高的负载，而无需增加成本更高的后端数据库.数据库查询结果缓存.持久会话缓存和整页缓存都是使用 ElastiCache for Redis 进行缓存的常用示例.https://aws.amazon.com/products/databases/real-time-apps-elasticache-for-redis /

body: Q100 Which of the following features can be configured through the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) Dashboard? (Select TWO.) 可以通过 Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) 仪表板配置以下哪些功能? （选择两个.）

choices.B: Amazon Route 53
choices.C: Security Groups->安全组
choices.D: Subnets->子网
choices.E: Elastic Load Balancing->弹性负载均衡

ans_desc: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define. You have complete control over your virtual networking environment, including selection of your own IP address range, creation of subnets, and configuration of route tables and network gateways. You can use both IPv4 and IPv6 in your VPC for secure and easy access to resources and applications. You can easily customize the network configuration for your Amazon VPC. For example, you can create a public-facing subnet for your web servers that has access to the Internet, and place your backend systems such as databases or application servers in a private-facing subnet with no Internet access. You canleverage multiple layers of security, including security groups and network access control lists, to help control access to Amazon EC2 instances in each subnet.https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/  Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) 允许您预置 AWS 云的逻辑隔离部分，您可以在其中启动您定义的虚拟网络中的 AWS 资源.您可以完全控制您的虚拟网络环境，包括选择您自己的 IP 地址范围.创建子网以及配置路由表和网络网关.您可以在 VPC 中同时使用 IPv4 和 IPv6，以安全.轻松地访问资源和应用程序.您可以轻松自定义 Amazon VPC 的网络配置.例如，您可以为可以访问 Internet 的 Web 服务器创建一个面向公众的子网，并将您的后端系统（例如数据库或应用程序服务器）放置在一个无法访问 Internet 的面向私有的子网中.您可以利用多个安全层（包括安全组和网络访问控制列表）来帮助控制对每个子网中的 Amazon EC2 实例的访问.https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

body: Q116 Which of the following services is in the category of AWS serverless platform? 以下哪些服务属于 AWS 无服务器平台类别?

ans_desc: AWS provides a set of fully managed services that you can use to build and run serverless applications. Serverless applications don't require provisioning, maintaining, and administering servers for backend components such as compute, databases, storage, stream processing, message queueing, and more. You also no longer need to worry about ensuring application fault tolerance and availability. Instead, AWS handles all of these capabilities for you. Serverless platform includes:AWS lambda, Amazon S3, DynamoDB, API gateway, Amazon SNS, AWS step functions, Amazon kinesis and developing tools and services.https://aws.amazon.com/serverless/  AWS 提供了一组完全托管的服务，您可以使用它们来构建和运行无服务器应用程序.无服务器应用程序不需要为后端组件（例如计算.数据库.存储.流处理.消息队列等）配置.维护和管理服务器.您也不再需要担心确保应用程序的容错性和可用性.相反，AWS 会为您处理所有这些功能.无服务器平台包括:AWS lambda.Amazon S3.DynamoDB.API 网关.Amazon SNS.AWS step functions.Amazon kinesis 以及开发工具和服务.https://aws.amazon.com/serverless/

ans_desc: CloudFront delivers your content through a worldwide network of data centers called edge locations. When a user requests content that you're serving with CloudFront, the user is routed to the edge location that provides the lowest latency (time delay), so that content is delivered with the best possible performance.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/Introduction.html  CloudFront 通过称为边缘站点的全球数据中心网络交付您的内容.当用户请求您使用 CloudFront 提供的内容时，用户将被路由到提供最低延迟（时间延迟）的边缘站点，以便以最佳性能交付内容.https://docs.aws. amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/Introduction.html

choices.B: Automatic failover->自动故障转移
choices.C: Round robin->循环赛
choices.D: Auto Scaling->自动缩放

ans_desc: AWS Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost. Using AWS Auto Scaling, it's easy to setup application scaling for multiple resources across multiple services in minutes. The service provides a simple, powerful user interface that lets you build scaling plans for resources including Amazon EC2 instances and Spot Fleets, Amazon ECS tasks, Amazon DynamoDB tables and indexes, and Amazon Aurora Replicas. AWS Auto Scaling makes scaling simple with recommendations that allow you to optimize performance, costs, or balance between them. If you're already using Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to dynamically scale your Amazon EC2 instances, you can now combine it with AWS Auto Scaling to scale additional resources for other AWS services. With AWS Auto Scaling, your applications always have the right resources at the right time.https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/  AWS Auto Scaling 监控您的应用程序并自动调整容量，以尽可能低的成本保持稳定.可预测的性能.使用 AWS Auto Scaling，您可以在几分钟内轻松设置跨多个服务的多个资源的应用程序扩展.该服务提供了一个简单而强大的用户界面，让您可以为包括 Amazon EC2 实例和 Spot 队列.Amazon ECS 任务.Amazon DynamoDB 表和索引以及 Amazon Aurora 副本在内的资源构建扩展计划. AWS Auto Scaling 通过可让您优化性能.成本或它们之间的平衡的建议使扩展变得简单.如果您已经在使用 Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling 来动态扩展您的 Amazon EC2 实例，您现在可以将其与 AWS Auto Scaling 结合使用来扩展其他 AWS 服务的额外资源.借助 AWS Auto Scaling，您的应用程序始终在正确的时间拥有正确的资源.https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/

ans_desc: AWS Artifact is your go-to, central resource for compliance-related information that matters to you. It provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports and select online agreements. Reports available in AWS Artifact include our Service Organization Control (SOC) reports, Payment Card Industry (PCI) reports, and certifications from accreditation bodies across geographies and compliance verticals that validate the implementation and operating effectiveness of AWS security controls. Agreements available in AWS Artifact include the Business Associate Addendum (BAA) and the Nondisclosure Agreement (NDA).https://aws.amazon.com/artifact/  AWS Artifact 是您重要的合规性相关信息的首选中央资源.它提供对 AWS 的安全性和合规性报告以及选择在线协议的按需访问. AWS Artifact 中提供的报告包括我们的服务组织控制 (SOC) 报告.支付卡行业 (PCI) 报告以及来自不同地区和合规性垂直领域的认证机构的认证，这些认证验证了 AWS 安全控制的实施和运营有效性. AWS Artifact 中可用的协议包括业务伙伴附录 (BAA) 和保密协议 (NDA).https://aws.amazon.com/artifact/

body: Q127 Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is a shared control between a customer and AWS? 在共享责任模型下，以下哪项是客户和 AWS 之间的共享控制?

choices.A: Physical controls->物理控制
choices.B: Patch management->补丁管理
choices.C: Zone security->区安全
choices.D: Data center auditing->数据中心审计

ans_desc: Shared Controls:Controls which apply to both the infrastructure layer and customer layers, but in completely separate contexts or perspectives. In a shared control, AWS provides the requirements for the infrastructure and the customer must provide their own control implementation within their use of AWS services. Examples include:Patch Management:AWS is responsible for patching and fixing flaws within the infrastructure, but customers are responsible for patching their guest OS and applications. Configuration Management:AWS maintains the configuration of its infrastructure devices, but a customer is responsible for configuring their own guest operating systems, databases, and applications. Awareness&Training AWS trains AWS employees,but a customer must train their owner employees. Customer Specific Controls which are solely the responsibility of the customer based on the application they are deploying within AWS services. Examples include:-Service and Communications Protection or Zone Security which may require a customer to route or zone data within specific security environments.https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/  共享控制:适用于基础设施层和客户层的控制，但在完全独立的上下文或视角中.在共享控制中，AWS 提供对基础设施的要求，客户必须在使用 AWS 服务时提供自己的控制实施.示例包括:补丁管理:AWS 负责修补和修复基础设施中的缺陷，但客户负责修补他们的客户操作系统和应用程序.配置管理:AWS 维护其基础设施设备的配置，但客户负责配置他们自己的客户操作系统.数据库和应用程序.意识和培训 AWS 培训 AWS 员工，但客户必须培训其所有者的员工.基于客户在 AWS 服务中部署的应用程序完全由客户负责的客户特定控制.示例包括:-服务和通信保护或区域安全，这可能要求客户在特定安全环境中路由或区域数据.https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

body: Q128 Which AWS service allows companies to connect an Amazon VPC to an on-premises data center? 哪种 AWS 服务允许公司将 Amazon VPC 连接到本地数据中心?

choices.A: AWS VPN
choices.B: Amazon Redshift
choices.C: API Gateway->API网关
choices.D: Amazon Direct Connect->Amazon 直连

ans_desc: AWS Direct Connect enables you to securely connect your AWS environment to your on-premises data center or office location over a standard 1 gigabit or 10 gigabit Ethernet fiber-optic connection. AWS Direct Connect offers dedicated high speed, low latency connection, which bypasses internet service providers inyour network path. An AWS Direct Connect location provides access to Amazon Web Services in the region it is associated with, as well as access to other US regions. AWS Direct Connect allows you to logically partition the fiber-optic connections into multiple logical connections called Virtual Local Area Networks(VLAN). You can take advantage of these logical connections to improve security, differentiate traffic, and achieve compliance requirements.https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/projects/connect-data-center-to-aws/  AWS Direct Connect 使您能够通过标准的 1 Gb 或 10 Gb 以太网光纤连接将您的 AWS 环境安全地连接到您的本地数据中心或办公室位置. AWS Direct Connect 提供专用的高速.低延迟连接，可绕过您网络路径中的互联网服务提供商. AWS Direct Connect 位置提供对其关联区域中的 Amazon Web Services 的访问，以及对其他美国区域的访问. AWS Direct Connect 允许您在逻辑上将光纤连接划分为多个称为虚拟局域网 (VLAN) 的逻辑连接.您可以利用这些逻辑连接来提高安全性.区分流量并实现合规性要求.https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/projects/connect-data-center-to-aws/

body: Q138 Which of the following are benefits of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.) 以下哪些是 AWS 云的优势? （选择两个.）

choices.A: Unlimited uptime->无限正常运行时间
choices.B: Elasticity->弹性
choices.C: Agility->敏捷
choices.D: Colocation->托管
choices.E: Capital expenses->资本支出

ans_desc: The most celebrated benefit of AWS cloud is elasticity since you can expand the services when you experience more traffic. With so much improvement and call for optimization in the cloud, it is necessary that these strategies get established from the ground up within the organizations. body: Q147 When is it beneficial for a company to use a Spot Instance? 公司何时使用 Spot 实例有益?

choices.A: When there is flexibility in when an application needs to run.->当应用程序需要运行时具有灵活性.
choices.B: When there are mission-critical workloads.->当有关键任务工作负载时.
choices.C: When dedicated capacity is needed.->当需要专用容量时.
choices.D: When an instance should not be stopped.->当一个实例不应该停止时.

ans_desc: The key to understanding spot instances is to look at the way that cloud service providers such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) operate. Cloud service providers invest in hardware resources and then release those resources (often on a per-hour basis) to subscribers. One of the problems with this business model, however, is that at any given time, there are likely to be compute resources that are not being utilized. These resources represent hardware capacity that AWS has paid for but are sitting idle, and not making AWS any money at the moment. Rather than allowing these computing resources to go to waste, AWS offers them at a substantially discounted rate, with the understanding that if someone needs those resources for running a normal EC2 instance, that instance will take priority over spot instances that are using the hardware resources at a discounted rate. In fact, spot instances will be stopped if the resources are needed elsewhere.https://awsinsider.net/articles/2017/09/25/aws-spot-instances-primer.aspx  理解 Spot 实例的关键是看Amazon 网络服务（AWS）等云服务提供商的运作方式.云服务提供商投资于硬件资源，然后将这些资源（通常以每小时为单位）释放给订阅者.然而，这种商业模式的问题之一是，在任何给定时间，都可能存在未被利用的计算资源.这些资源代表 AWS 已支付但处于闲置状态的硬件容量，目前还没有为 AWS 带来任何收益. AWS 不会让这些计算资源浪费，而是以大幅折扣价提供它们，并理解如果有人需要这些资源来运行正常的 EC2 实例，该实例将优先于使用硬件资源的现货实例以折扣价.事实上，如果其他地方需要资源，Spot 实例将停止. https://awsinsider.net/articles/2017/09/25/aws-spot-instances-primer.aspx

body: Q149 How does AWS charge for AWS Lambda? AWS 如何对 AWS Lambda 收费?

choices.A: Users bid on the maximum price they are willing to pay per hour.->用户按他们愿意支付的每小时最高价格出价.
choices.B: Users choose a 1-, 3-or 5-year upfront payment term.->用户选择 1 年.3 年或 5 年的预付款期限.
choices.C: Users pay for the required permanent storage on a file system or in a database.->用户为文件系统或数据库中所需的永久存储付费.
choices.D: Users pay based on the number of requests and consumed compute resources.->用户根据请求数量和消耗的计算资源付费.

ans_desc: AWS Lambda is charging its users by the number of requests for their functions and by the duration, which is the time the code needs to execute. When code starts running in response to an event, AWS Lambda counts a request. It will charge the total number of requests across all of the functions used. Duration is calculated by the time when your code started executing until it returns or until it is terminated, rounded up near to 100ms. The AWS Lambda pricing depends on the amount of memory that the user used to allocate to the function.https://dashbird.io/blog/aws-lambda-pricing-model-explained/  AWS Lambda 按其函数的请求数量和持续时间（即代码需要执行的时间）向用户收费.当代码开始运行以响应事件时，AWS Lambda 会对请求进行计数.它将对使用的所有功能的请求总数收费.持续时间是根据您的代码开始执行直到它返回或直到它终止的时间计算的，四舍五入接近 100 毫秒. AWS Lambda 定价取决于用户用于分配给函数的内存量.https://dashbird.io/blog/aws-lambda-pricing-model-explained/

body: Q150 What function do security groups serve related Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance security? 安全组为相关的 Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) 实例安全提供什么功能?

choices.A: Act as a virtual firewall for the Amazon EC2 instance.->充当 Amazon EC2 实例的虚拟防火墙.
choices.B: Secure AWS user accounts with AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.->使用 AWS 身份和访问管理 (IAM) 策略保护 AWS 用户账户.
choices.C: Provide DDoS protection with AWS Shield.->使用 AWS Shield 提供 DDoS 保护.
choices.D: Use Amazon CloudFront to protect the Amazon EC2 instance.->使用 Amazon CloudFront 保护 Amazon EC2 实例.

ans_desc: AWS Security Groups act like a firewall for your Amazon EC2 instances controlling both inbound and outbound traffic. When you launch an instance on Amazon EC2, you need to assign it to a particular security group. After that, you can set up ports and protocols, which remain open for users and computers over the internet. AWS Security Groups are very flexible. You can use the default security group and still customize it according to your liking (although we don't recommend this practice because groups should be named according to their purpose.) Or you can create a security group that you want for your specific applications. To do this, you can write the corresponding code or use the Amazon EC2 console to make the process easier.https://www.threatstack.com/blog/aws-security-groups-what-they-are-and-how-to-get-the-most-out-of-them  AWS 安全组充当您的 Amazon EC2 实例的防火墙，控制入站和出站流量.在 Amazon EC2 上启动实例时，您需要将其分配给特定的安全组.之后，您可以设置端口和协议，这些端口和协议仍然对 Internet 上的用户和计算机开放. AWS 安全组非常灵活.您可以使用默认安全组并仍然根据自己的喜好对其进行自定义（尽管我们不推荐这种做法，因为组应根据其用途命名.）或者您可以为特定应用程序创建所需的安全组.为此，您可以编写相应的代码或使用 Amazon EC2 控制台来简化该过程.https://www.threatstack.com/blog/aws-security-groups-what-they-are-and-how-获得最大的收益

body: Q151 Which disaster recovery scenario offers the lowest probability of down time? 哪种灾难恢复方案提供最低的停机概率?

choices.A: Backup and restore->备份和恢复
choices.B: Pilot light->指示灯
choices.C: Warm standby->热备
choices.D: Multi-site active-active->多站点主动-主动

ans_desc: Backup and Restore:a simple, straightforward, cost-effective method that backs up and restores data as needed. Keep in mind that because none of your data is on standby, this method, while cheap, can be quite time-consuming. Pilot Light:This method keeps critical applications and data at the ready so that it can be quickly retrieved if needed. Warm Standby:This method keeps a duplicate version of your business' core elements running on standby at all times, which makes for a little downtime and an almost seamless transition. Multi-Site Solution:Also known as a Hot Standby, this method fully replicates your company's data/applications between two or more active locations and splits your traffic/usage between them. If a disaster strikes, everything is simply rerouted to the unaffected area, which means you'll suffer almost zero downtime.However, by running two separate environments simultaneously, you will obviously incur much higher costs.https://cloudranger.com/best-practices-aws-disaster-recovery-planning/  备份和恢复:一种简单.直接.经济高效的方法，可根据需要备份和恢复数据.请记住，由于您的数据都没有处于待机状态，因此这种方法虽然便宜，但可能非?氖薄Ｖ甘镜?此方法可随时准备好关键应用程序和数据，以便在需要时快速检索.暖待机:此方法使您的业务核心元素的副本版本始终处于待机状态，从而缩短停机时间并实现几乎无缝的过渡.多站点解决方案:也称为热备，此方法在两个或多个活动位置之间完全复制您公司的数据/应用程序，并在它们之间拆分您的流量/使用情况.如果发生灾难，一切都只是重新路由到未受影响的区域，这意味着您将遭受几乎零停机时间.但是，通过同时运行两个独立的环境，您显然会产生更高的成本.https://cloudranger.com/best -practices-aws-灾难恢复计划/

ans_desc: The way that Reserved Instance discounts apply to accounts in an organization's consolidated billing family depends on whether Reserved Instance sharing is turned on or off for the account. The capacity reservation for a Reserved Instance applies only to the account the Reserved Instance was purchased on, regardless of whether Reserved Instance sharing is turned on or off.https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-ri-consolidated-billing/  预留实例折扣适用于组织整合账单系列中的账户的方式取决于是否为账户开启或关闭预留实例共享.默认情况下，组织中所有账户的预留实例共享已打开.您可以通过为账户关闭预留实例共享来更改此设置.预留实例的容量预留仅适用于购买预留实例的账户，无论预留实例共享是打开还是关闭.https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-ri -合并计费/

ans_desc: Cloudfront enables low-latency delivery to the end users by caching the frequently used data to the edge locations. body: Q156 Which of the following deployment models enables customers to fully trade their capital IT expenses for operational expenses? 以下哪种部署模型使客户能够将其资本 IT 支出完全换成运营支出?

choices.A: On-premises->本地
choices.B: Hybrid->混合型
choices.C: Cloud->云

ans_desc: The cloud allows you to trade capital expenses (such as data centers and physical servers) for variable expenses, and only pay for IT as you consume it. Firewall configuration remains the responsibility of the end user, which integrates at the platform and application management level. For example, RDS utilizes security groups, which you would be responsible for configuring and implementing.https://cloudacademy.com/blog/aws-shared-responsibility-model-security/  有了 AWS 保护和维护的基本云基础设施，进入云的责任就落在了您身上.这包括客户端和服务器端加密和网络流量保护.操作系统安全.网络和防火墙配置，然后是应用程序安全以及身份和访问管理.防火墙配置仍然是最终用户的责任，它集成在平台和应用程序管理级别.例如，RDS 使用安全组，您将负责配置和实施.https://cloudacademy.com/blog/aws-shared-responsibility-model-security/

body: Q165 Which AWS hybrid storage service enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use AWS Cloud storage through standard file-storage protocols? 哪种 AWS 混合存储服务使本地应用程序能够通过标准文件存储协议无缝使用 AWS 云存储?

choices.A: AWS Direct Connect->AWS 直接连接
choices.B: AWS Snowball
choices.C: AWS Storage Gateway->AWS 存储网关
choices.D: AWS Snowball Edge->AWS Snowball边缘

ans_desc: The AWS Storage Gateway service enables hybrid cloud storage between on-premises environments and the AWS Cloud. It seamlessly integrates on-premises enterprise applications and workflows with Amazon's block and object cloud storage services through industry standard storage protocols. It provides low-latency performance by caching frequently accessed data on premises, while storing data securely and durably in Amazon cloud storage services. It provides an optimized data transfer mechanism and bandwidth management, which tolerates unreliable networks and minimizes the amount of data being transferred. It brings the security, manageability, durability, and scalability of AWS to existing enterprise environments through native integration with AWS encryption, identity management, monitoring, and storage services. Typical use cases include backup and archiving, disaster recovery, moving data to S3 for in-cloud workloads, and tiered storage.https://aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/faqs/  AWS Storage Gateway 服务支持本地环境和 AWS 云之间的混合云存储.它通过行业标准存储协议将本地企业应用程序和工作流程与 Amazon 的块和对象云存储服务无缝集成.它通过在本地缓存经常访问的数据来提供低延迟性能，同时将数据安全持久地存储在 Amazon 云存储服务中.它提供了优化的数据传输机制和带宽管理，可以容忍不可靠的网络并最大限度地减少传输的数据量.它通过与 AWS 加密.身份管理.监控和存储服务的原生集成，将 AWS 的安全性.可管理性.持久性和可扩展性带入现有的企业环境.典型用例包括备份和归档.灾难恢复.将数据移动到 S3 以用于云端工作负载以及分层存储.https://aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/faqs/

body: Q167 Which architectural principle is used when deploying an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance in Multiple Availability Zone mode? 在多可用区模式下部署 Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) 实例时使用哪种架构原则?

choices.A: Implement loose coupling.->实现松耦合.
choices.B: Design for failure.->为失败而设计.
choices.C: Automate everything that can be automated.->自动化所有可以自动化的东西.
choices.D: Use services, not servers.->使用服务，而不是服务器.

ans_desc: Amazon RDS Multi-AZ deployments provide enhanced availability and durability for Database (DB) Instances, making them a natural fit for production database workloads. When you provision a Multi-AZ DB Instance, Amazon RDS automatically creates a primary DB Instance and synchronously replicates the data to a standby instance in a different Availability Zone (AZ). Each AZ runs on its own physically distinct, independent infrastructure, and is engineered to be highly reliable. In case of an infrastructure failure, Amazon RDS performs an automatic failover to the standby (or to a read replica in the case of Amazon Aurora), so that you can resume database operations as soon as the failover is complete. Since the endpoint for your DB Instance remains the same after a failover, your application can resume database operation without the need for manual administrative intervention.https://aws.amazon.com/rds/details/multi-az/  Amazon RDS 多可用区部署为数据库 (DB) 实例提供增强的可用性和持久性，使其自然适合生产数据库工作负载.当您预置多可用区数据库实例时，Amazon RDS 会自动创建一个主数据库实例并将数据同步复制到不同可用区 (AZ) 中的备用实例.每个 AZ 都在其自己的物理上不同的独立基础架构上运行，并且设计为高度可靠.如果基础设施发生故障，Amazon RDS 会自动故障转移到备用数据库（或 Amazon Aurora 的只读副本），以便您可以在故障转移完成后立即恢复数据库操作.由于您的数据库实例的端点在故障转移后保持不变，因此您的应用程序可以恢复数据库操作而无需手动管理干预.https://aws.amazon.com/rds/details/multi-az/

body: Q169 What is a benefit of loose coupling as a principle of cloud architecture design? 作为云架构设计原则的松散耦合有什么好处?

choices.A: It facilitates low-latency request handling.->它有助于低延迟请求处理.
choices.B: It allows applications to have dependent workflows.->它允许应用程序有依赖的工作流.
choices.C: It prevents cascading failures between different components.->它可以防止不同组件之间的级联故障.
choices.D: It allows companies to focus on their physical data center operations.->它允许公司专注于他们的物理数据中心运营.

ans_desc: IT systems should ideally be designed in a way that reduces inter-dependencies. Your components need to be loosely coupled to avoid changes or failure in one of the components from affecting others. Your infrastructure also needs to have well defined interfaces that allow the various components to interact with each other only through specific, technology-agnostic interfaces. Modifying any underlying operations without affecting other components should be made possible.https://www.botmetric.com/blog/aws-cloud-architecture-design-principles/  理想情况下，IT 系统应该以减少相互依赖的方式设计.您的组件需要松散耦合，以避免其中一个组件的更改或故障影响其他组件.您的基础设施还需要有明确定义的接口，允许各种组件仅通过特定的.与技术无关的接口相互交互.应该可以在不影响其他组件的情况下修改任何底层操作. https://www.botmetric.com/blog/aws-cloud-architecture-design-principles/

ans_desc: Amazon VPC provides multiple network connectivity options for you to leverage depending on your current network designs and requirements. Additionally, with AWS, you can choose how network routing is delivered between Amazon VPC and your networks, leveraging either AWS or user-managed network equipment and routes.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-vpc-connectivity-options/introduction.html  Amazon VPC 提供多种网络连接选项供您使用，具体取决于您当前的网络设计和要求.这些连接选项包括利用 Internet 或 AWS Direct Connect 连接作为网络主干，并将连接终止到 AWS 或用户管理的网络端点.此外，借助 AWS，您可以选择如何在 Amazon VPC 和您的网络之间传递网络路由，利用 AWS 或用户管理的网络设备和路由.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws- vpc 连接选项/introduction.html

body: Q184 Which of the following services is a MySQL-compatible database that automatically grows storage as needed? 以下哪些服务是与 MySQL 兼容的数据库，可以根据需要自动增加存储空间?

choices.A: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)->Amazon 弹性计算云 (Amazon EC2)
choices.B: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for MySQL
choices.C: Amazon Lightsail
choices.D: Amazon Aurora

ans_desc: Amazon Aurora is a relational database service that combines the speed and availability of high-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost-effectiveness of open source databases. The MySQL-compatible edition of Aurora delivers up to 5X the throughput of standard MySQL running on the same hardware, and enables existing MySQL applications and tools to run without requiring modification. Amazon Aurora will automatically grow the size of your database volume as your database storage needs grow. Your volume will grow in increments of 10 GB up to a maximum of 64 TB. You don't need to provision excess storage for your database to handle future growth.https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/mysql-features/  Amazon Aurora 是一种关系型数据库服务，将高端商业数据库的速度和可用性与开源数据库的简单性和成本效益相结合.与 MySQL 兼容的 Aurora 版本的吞吐量是在相同硬件上运行的标准 MySQL 的 5 倍，并且无需修改即可运行现有的 MySQL 应用程序和工具.随着数据库存储需求的增长，Amazon Aurora 会自动增加数据库卷的大小.您的卷将以 10 GB 的增量增长，最高可达 64 TB.您无需为数据库配置多余的存储来应对未来的增长.https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/mysql-features/

body: Q185 Which Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) feature enables users to connect two VPCs together? Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) 的哪项功能使用户能够将两个 VPC 连接在一起?

choices.B: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) ClassicLink
choices.C: Amazon VPC peering->Amazon VPC 对等
choices.D: AWS Direct Connect->AWS 直接连接

ans_desc: A VPC peering connection is a networking connection between two VPCs that enables you to route traffic between them using private IPv4 addresses or IPv6 addresses. Instances in either VPC can communicate with each other as if they are within the same network. You can create a VPC peering connection between your own VPCs, or with a VPC in another AWS account. The VPCs can be in different regions (also known as an inter-region VPC peering connection).https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/peering/what-is-vpc-peering.html  VPC 对等连接是两个 VPC 之间的网络连接，使您能够使用私有 IPv4 地址或 IPv6 地址在它们之间路由流量.任一 VPC 中的实例都可以相互通信，就好像它们在同一个网络中一样.您可以在自己的 VPC 之间或与另一个 AWS 账户中的 VPC 之间创建 VPC 对等连接. VPC 可以位于不同的区域（也称为区域间 VPC 对等连接）. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/peering/what-is-vpc-peering.html

body: Q188 Which AWS service provides a secure, fast, and cost-effective way to migrate or transport exabyte-scale datasets into AWS? 哪种 AWS 服务提供了一种安全.快速且经济高效的方式来将 EB 级数据集迁移或传输到 AWS?

choices.B: AWS Snowball
choices.C: AWS Migration Hub->AWS 迁移中心
choices.D: AWS Snowmobile->AWS 雪地摩托

ans_desc: AWS Snowmobile is an exabyte-scale data transfer service that can move extremely large amounts of data to AWS in a fast, secure, and cost-effective manner. You can transfer up to 100PB per Snowmobile, a 45-foot long ruggedized shipping container, pulled by a semi-trailer truck. Snowmobile makes it easy to move massive volumes of data to the cloud, including video libraries, image repositories, or even a complete data center migration. All data is encrypted with 256-bit encryption and you can manage your encryption keys with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). Snowmobile includes GPS tracking, alarm monitoring, 24/7 video surveillance and an optional escort security vehicle while in transit.https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2016/11/move-exabyte-scale-data-sets-with-aws-snowmobile/  AWS Snowmobile 是一种 EB 级数据传输服务，可以以快速.安全且经济高效的方式将大量数据传输到 AWS.每个 Snowmobile 最多可以传输 100PB，这是一个 45 英尺长的坚固运输集装箱，由半挂车牵引. Snowmobile 可以轻松地将大量数据迁移到云端，包括视频库.图像存储库，甚至是完整的数据中心迁移.所有数据均使用 256 位加密进行加密，您可以使用 AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) 管理您的加密密钥. Snowmobile 包括 GPS 跟踪.警报监控.24/7 视频监控和可选的护送安全车辆.https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2016/11/move-exabyte-scale -data-sets-with-aws-snowmobile/

body: Q192 Which solution provides the FASTEST application response times to frequently accessed data to users in multiple AWS Regions? 哪种解决方案为多个 AWS 区域中的用户频繁访问的数据提供最快的应用程序响应时间?

choices.A: AWS CloudTrail across multiple Availability Zones->AWS CloudTrail 跨多个可用区
choices.B: Amazon CloudFront to edge locations->Amazon CloudFront 到边缘站点
choices.C: AWS CloudFormation in multiple regions->AWS CloudFormation 在多个区域
choices.D: A virtual private gateway over AWS Direct Connect->基于 AWS Direct Connect 的虚拟私有网关

ans_desc: You can deliver content and decrease end-user latency of your web application using Amazon CloudFront. CloudFront speeds up content delivery by leveraging its global network of data centers, known as edge locations, to reduce delivery time by caching your content close to your end users. CloudFront fetches your content from an origin, such as an Amazon S3 bucket, an Amazon EC2 instance, an Amazon Elastic Load Balancing load balancer or your own web server, when it's not already in an edge location. CloudFront can be used to deliver your entire website or application, including dynamic, static, streaming, and interactive content.https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/tutorials/deliver-content-faster/  您可以使用 Amazon CloudFront 交付内容并减少 Web 应用程序的最终用户延迟. CloudFront 通过利用其全球数据中心网络（称为边缘站点）来加快内容交付速度，通过缓存靠近最终用户的内容来缩短交付时间. CloudFront 会从源（例如 Amazon S3 存储桶.Amazon EC2 实例.Amazon Elastic Load Balancing 负载均衡器或您自己的 Web 服务器）获取您的内容，前提是它尚未位于边缘位置. CloudFront 可用于交付您的整个网站或应用程序，包括动态.静态.流式传输和交互式内容.https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/tutorials/deliver-content-faster/

ans_desc: AWS Artifact is your go-to, central resource for compliance-related information that matters to you. It provides on-demand access to AWS' security and compliance reports and select online agreements. Reports available in AWS Artifact include our Service Organization Control (SOC) reports, Payment Card Industry (PCI) reports, and certifications from accreditation bodies across geographies and compliance verticals that validate the implementation and operating effectiveness of AWS security controls. Agreements available in AWS Artifact include the Business Associate Addendum (BAA) and the Nondisclosure Agreement (NDA).https://aws.amazon.com/artifact/  AWS Artifact 是您重要的合规性相关信息的首选中央资源.它提供对 AWS 的安全性和合规性报告以及选择在线协议的按需访问. AWS Artifact 中提供的报告包括我们的服务组织控制 (SOC) 报告.支付卡行业 (PCI) 报告以及来自不同地区和合规性垂直领域的认证机构的认证，这些认证验证了 AWS 安全控制的实施和运营有效性. AWS Artifact 中可用的协议包括业务伙伴附录 (BAA) 和保密协议 (NDA).https://aws.amazon.com/artifact/

ans_desc: You can continue to optimize your spend and keep your development costs low by making sure you revisit your architecture often, to adjust to your startup growth. ans_desc: You can monitor your estimated AWS charges by using Amazon CloudWatch. This data includes the estimated charges for every service in AWS that you use, in addition to the estimated overall total of your AWS charges.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/monitor_estimated_charges_with_cloudwatch.html  您可以使用 Amazon CloudWatch 监控估计的 AWS 费用.当您为您的 AWS 账户启用对估计费用的监控时，会计算估计费用并将其作为指标数据每天多次发送到 CloudWatch.计费指标数据存储在美国东部（弗吉尼亚北部）区域，代表全球费用.此数据包括您在 AWS 中使用的每项服务的估计费用，以及您的 AWS 费用估计总额. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/monitor_estimated_charges_with_cloudwatch.html

ans_desc: Media storage devices used to store customer data are classified by AWS as Critical and treated accordingly, as high impact, throughout their life-cycles. AWS has exacting standards on how to install, service, and eventually destroy the devices when they are no longer useful. When a storage device has reached the end of its useful life, AWS decommissions media using techniques detailed in NIST 800-88. Media that stored customer data is not removed from AWS control until it has been securely decommissioned.https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/data-center/controls/  用于存储客户数据的媒体存储设备被 AWS 归类为关键设备，并在其整个生命周期中被相应地视为高影响. AWS 对如何安装.服务以及在设备不再有用时最终销毁设备有严格的标准.当存储设备达到其使用寿命时，AWS 会使用 NIST 800-88 中详述的技术停用媒体.存储客户数据的媒体在安全退役之前不会从 AWS 控制中移除.https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/data-center/controls/

body: Q227 Which of the following allows users to provision a dedicated network connection from their internal network to AWS? 以下哪项允许用户提供从其内部网络到 AWS 的专用网络连接?

ans_desc: AWS Direct Connect lets you establish a dedicated network connection between your network and one of the AWS Direct Connect locations. Using industry standard 802.1q VLANs, this dedicated connection can be partitioned into multiple virtual interfaces. This allows you to use the same connection to access public resources such as objects stored in Amazon S3 using public IP address space, and private resources such as Amazon EC2 instances running within an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) using private IP space, while maintaining network separation between the public and private environments. Virtual interfaces can be reconfigured at any time to meet your changing needs.https://aws.amazon.com/directconnect/  AWS Direct Connect 允许您在您的网络和 AWS Direct Connect 位置之一之间建立专用网络连接.使用行业标准 802.1q VLAN，这个专用连接可以划分为多个虚拟接口.这允许您使用相同的连接来访问公共资源，例如使用公共 IP 地址空间存储在 Amazon S3 中的对象，以及使用私有 IP 空间在 Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) 中运行的 Amazon EC2 实例等私有资源，同时维护公共和私有环境之间的网络分离.可以随时重新配置虚拟接口以满足您不断变化的需求.https://aws.amazon.com/directconnect/

body: Q259 A web application running on AWS has been spammed with malicious requests from a recurring set of IP addresses.Which AWS service can help secure the application and block the malicious traffic? 在 AWS 上运行的 Web 应用程序收到来自一组重复 IP 地址的恶意请求的垃圾邮件.哪种 AWS 服务可以帮助保护应用程序并阻止恶意流量?

choices.B: Amazon GuardDuty

ans_desc: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect web applications from common web exploits that could affect application availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources. You can use AWS WAF to define customizable web security rules that control which traffic accesses your web applications. If you use AWS Shield Advanced, you can use AWS WAF at no extra cost for those protected resources and can engage the DRT to create WAF rules.https://aws.amazon.com/answers/networking/aws-ddos-attack-mitigation/  AWS WAF 是一种 Web 应用程序防火墙，可帮助保护 Web 应用程序免受可能影响应用程序可用性.危及安全性或消耗过多资源的常见 Web 攻击.您可以使用 AWS WAF 定义可自定义的 Web 安全规则，以控制哪些流量访问您的 Web 应用程序.如果您使用 AWS Shield Advanced，您可以免费为这些受保护资源使用 AWS WAF，并且可以让 DRT 创建 WAF 规则.https://aws.amazon.com/answers/networking/aws-ddos-attack-减轻/

With multiple virtual interfaces, you can even establish private connectivity to multiple VPCs while maintaining network isolation.https://aws.amazon.com/directconnect/  您可以使用 AWS Direct Connect 建立从您的本地网络直接到您的 Amazon VPC 的私有虚拟接口，从而为您的网络和 VPC 之间提供私有.高带宽的网络连接.借助多个虚拟接口，您甚至可以建立与多个 VPC 的私有连接，同时保持网络隔离.https://aws.amazon.com/directconnect/

body: Q262 Which AWS service can be used to query stored datasets directly from Amazon S3 using standard SQL? 哪个 AWS 服务可用于使用标准 SQL 直接从 Amazon S3 查询存储的数据集?

choices.B: AWS Data Pipeline->AWS 数据管道
choices.C: Amazon CloudSearch->Amazon 云搜索
choices.D: Amazon Athena->Amazon 雅典娜

ans_desc: Amazon Athena is defined as "an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyse data directly in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) using standard SQL." So, it's another SQL query engine for large data sets stored in S3. This is very similar to other SQL query engines, such as Apache Drill. But unlike Apache Drill, Athena is limited to data only from Amazon's own S3 storage service. However, Athena is able to query a variety of file formats, including, but not limited to CSV, Parquet, JSON, etc.  Amazon Athena 被定义为"一种交互式查询服务，可以轻松地使用标准 SQL 直接在 Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) 中分析数据".因此，它是存储在 S3 中的大型数据集的另一个 SQL 查询引擎.这与其他 SQL 查询引擎非常相似，例如 Apache Drill.但与 Apache Drill 不同的是，Athena 仅限于来自Amazon 自己的 S3 存储服务的数据.但是，Athena 能够查询多种文件格式，包括但不限于 CSV.Parquet.JSON 等.

choices.A: Review the inbound rules for each security group in the Amazon EC2 management console to check for port 0.0.0.0/0.->在 Amazon EC2 管理控制台中查看每个安全组的入站规则以检查端口 0.0.0.0/0.
choices.B: Run AWS Trusted Advisor and review the findings.->运行 AWS Trusted Advisor 并查看结果.

ans_desc: A is wrong as 0.0.0.0/0 is not a port but IP Address range;C is wrong as IAM is not about inbound rules;D is wrong as AWS Config is a service that enables you to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your AWS resources  A 错误，因为 0.0.0.0/0 不是端口而是 IP 地址范围；C 错误，因为 IAM 与入站规则无关；D 错误，因为 AWS Config 是一项使您能够评估.审计和评估的服务您的 AWS 资源的配置

body: Q267 A user needs an automated security assessment report that will identify unintended network access to Amazon EC2 instances and vulnerabilities on those instances.Which AWS service will provide this assessment report? 用户需要一份自动安全评估报告，该报告将识别对 Amazon EC2 实例的意外网络访问以及这些实例上的漏洞.哪个 AWS 服务将提供此评估报告?

choices.A: EC2 security groups->EC2 安全组
choices.B: AWS Config->AWS 配置
choices.C: Amazon Macie
choices.D: Amazon Inspector->Amazon 检查员

ans_desc: Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS. Amazon Inspector automatically assesses applications for exposure, vulnerabilities, and deviations from best practices. After performing an assessment, Amazon Inspector produces a detailed list of security findings prioritized by level of severity. These findings can be reviewed directly or as part of detailed assessment reports which are available via the Amazon Inspector console or API.https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/  Amazon Inspector 是一项自动化安全评估服务，有助于提高部署在 AWS 上的应用程序的安全性和合规性. Amazon Inspector 自动评估应用程序的风险.漏洞和与最佳实践的偏差.执行评估后，Amazon Inspector 会生成一份详细的安全发现列表，按严重程度排列优先级.这些发现可以直接查看，也可以作为详细评估报告的一部分进行查看，这些报告可通过 Amazon Inspector 控制台或 API 获得.https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/

body: Q270 A Cloud Practitioner needs to store data for 7 years to meet regulatory requirements.Which AWS service will meet this requirement at the LOWEST cost? 云从业者需要将数据存储 7 年才能满足监管要求.哪种 AWS 服务能够以最低的成本满足这一要求?

choices.A: Amazon S3
choices.B: AWS Snowball
choices.C: Amazon Redshift
choices.D: Amazon S3 Glacier->Amazon S3 冰川

ans_desc: S3 Glacier Deep Archive is Amazon S3's lowest-cost storage class and supports long-term retention and digital preservation for data that may be accessed once or twice in a year. It is designed for customers--particularly those in highly-regulated industries, such as the Financial Services, Healthcare, and Public Sectors--that retain data sets for 7-10 years or longer to meet regulatory compliance requirements. S3 Glacier Deep Archive can also be used for backup and disaster recovery use cases, and is a cost-effective and easy-to-manage alternative to magnetic tape systems, whether they are on-premises libraries or offpremises services.https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/  S3 Glacier Deep Archive 是 Amazon S3 成本最低的存储类，支持对一年内可能访问一次或两次的数据进行长期保留和数字化保存.它专为将数据集保留 7 到 10 年或更长时间以满足监管合规要求的客户（尤其是金融服务.医疗保健和公共部门等高度监管行业的客户）而设计. S3 Glacier Deep Archive 还可用于备份和灾难恢复用例，是磁带系统的经济高效且易于管理的替代方案，无论是本地库还是非本地服务.https://aws .amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/

ans_desc: Amazon Macie is a security service that uses machine learning to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data in AWS. Macie recognizes sensitive data such as personally identifiable information (PII) or intellectual property. It provides you with dashboards and alerts that give visibility into how this data is being accessed or moved.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/macie/latest/userguide/what-is-macie.html  Amazon Macie 是一项安全服务，它使用机器学习来自动发现.分类和保护 AWS 中的敏感数据. Macie 识别敏感数据，例如个人身份信息 (PII) 或知识产权.它为您提供仪表板和警报，让您了解这些数据是如何被访问或移动的.https://docs.aws.amazon.com/macie/latest/userguide/what-is-macie.html

body: Q273 What is the purpose of AWS Storage Gateway? AWS Storage Gateway 的用途是什么?

choices.A: It ensures on-premises data storage is 99.999999999% durable.->它确保本地数据存储具有 99.999999999% 的持久性.
choices.B: It transports petabytes of data to and from AWS.->它在 AWS 之间传输 PB 级的数据.
choices.C: It connects to multiple Amazon EC2 instances.->它连接到多个 Amazon EC2 实例.
choices.D: It connects on-premises data storage to the AWS Cloud.->它将本地数据存储连接到 AWS 云.

ans_desc: Moving data to the cloud is not quite as simple as flipping a switch. For companies that have managed their own data centers or server rooms for decades, there are a few steps to consider--and it's not always wise to pull the plug on an internal infrastructure quite so quickly. If a startup uses on-premise business servers and then experiences unexpected growth, abandoning those servers doesn't make sense (even if the long-term plan is to do exactly that). AWS Storage Gateway is a way to bridge this gap for companies of any size. It's a hybrid storage option that connects on-premise storage including age-old tape backup systems to the cloud in a way that also provides one console to access all storage configurations.https://www.techradar.com/news/what-is-aws-storage-gateway  将数据移动到云端并不像拨动开关那么简单.对于几十年来管理自己的数据中心或服务器机房的公司，有几个步骤需要考虑——而且这么快拔掉内部基础设施的插头并不总是明智的.如果一家初创公司使用本地业务服务器，然后经历了意外的增长，那么放弃这些服务器是没有意义的（即使长期计划就是这样做）. AWS Storage Gateway 是为任何规模的公司弥合这一差距的一种方式.这是一种混合存储选项，可将包括古老磁带备份系统在内的本地存储连接到云，同时还提供一个控制台来访问所有存储配置.https://www.techradar.com/news/what-is -aws-存储网关

ans_desc: AWS CloudTrail is a service that enables governance, compliance, operational auditing, and risk auditing of your AWS account. With CloudTrail, you can log, continuously monitor, and retain account activity related to actions across your AWS infrastructure. CloudTrail provides event history of your AWS account activity, including actions taken through the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command line tools,and other AWS services. This event history simplifies security analysis, resource change tracking, and troubleshooting. In addition, you can use CloudTrail to detect unusual activity in your AWS accounts.These capabilities help simplify operational analysis and troubleshooting.https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/  AWS CloudTrail 是一项服务，可以对您的 AWS 账户进行治理.合规性.操作审计和风险审计.借助 CloudTrail，您可以记录.持续监控和保留与您的 AWS 基础设施中的操作相关的账户活动. CloudTrail 提供您的 AWS 账户活动的事件历史记录，包括通过 AWS 管理控制台.AWS 开发工具包.命令行工具和其他 AWS 服务执行的操作.此事件历史记录简化了安全分析.资源更改跟踪和故障排除.此外，您可以使用 CloudTrail 检测 AWS 账户中的异常活动.这些功能有助于简化操作分析和故障排除.https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

body: Q300 Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads? 对于具有不同计算工作负载的应用程序，为什么 AWS 比传统数据中心更经济?

choices.A: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) costs are billed on a monthly basis.->Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) 费用按月计费.
choices.B: Customers retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances.->客户保留对其 Amazon EC2 实例的完全管理访问权限.
choices.C: Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed.->Amazon EC2 实例可以在需要时按需启动.
choices.D: Customers can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads.->客户可以永久运行足够的实例来处理峰值工作负载.

ans_desc: The ability to launch instances on-demand when needed allows customers launch and terminate instances in response to a varying workload. This is a more economical practice than purchasing enough onpremises servers to handle the peak load.  在需要时按需启动实例的能力允许客户启动和终止实例以响应变化的工作负载.与购买足够的本地服务器来处理峰值负载相比，这是一种更经济的做法.
